intro: Chamaecrista desvauxii, commonly known as the yellow burr legume, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow, pea-like flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by distinctive, spiny pods. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Chamaecrista desvauxii is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitats.
